CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 11, 1944, pg. 15, reads: "Permanent Wave Over Pressed Hair - Reading left to right: Mrs. F. D. Foy, Mrs. Devonshire, Mr. A. W. Wright of Florida A. & M. college; Mrs. E. M. King, Mrs. E. Smith, Mrs. S. Jones, Mrs. Harry Fitzgerald and Mrs. J. M. Hooper, one of the Permanent Wave models. Second row:  Miss Faisont, of the Health Department of the Bedford hospital; Misses Sadie Wynn, Wynona Graves, director Clark, Mary Carpenter and Rachel Harris, students of the LaSalle Beauty School.  Third row:  Mrs. Hughley, Mrs. Veola Moon, manager of La Salle Beauty Salon; Miss Cherry, Louise Farrish, teacher in LaSalle Vocational School; Misses P. Washington, E. Hillyer and Ethel Jones, the latter another Permanent Wave model; Mrs. Samuel of LaSalle School; Mrs. Richard Jones and Mrs. Alberta Williams, secretary of Girls' Reserve of the Centre Avenue Branch YMCA.  The above guest list attended a demonstration in permanent waving, without electricity, over pressed hair, at the LaSalle School, 3066 Centre avenue, on February 22 - Photo by Harris Studio."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait, including Mrs. F. D. Foy, Mrs. Devonshire, A. W. Wright, Mrs. E. M. King, Mrs. E. Smith, Mrs. S. Jones, Mrs. Harry Fitzgerald, Mrs. J. M. Hooper, Faisont, Sadie Wynn, Wynona Farrish Graves, Ms. Clark, Mary Carpenter, Rachel Harris, Mrs. Hughley, Veola Farrish Moon, Ms. Cherry, Louise Farrish, P. Washington, E. Hillyer, Ethel Jones, Mrs. Samuel, Mrs. Richard Jones, and Alberta Williams, gathered at LaSalle Beauty School for permanent wave demonstration
